title: Entities and Resolution
summary: FLS Chapter 14 defines entities, visibility, paths, scopes, namespaces, preludes, use imports, shadowing, and resolution. iceoryx2 demonstrates comprehensive use of these concepts with 4,889 public items, 671 pub(crate) items, 2,874 use imports, 3,525 crate:: paths, 331 qualified paths, and 1,579 Self references. The codebase uses visibility modifiers strategically for API design and internal implementation hiding.

14.1:1_to_14.1:3.rule: An entity is a construct that can be referred to. A name is an identifier that refers to an entity. A declaration introduces a name for an entity.

14.1:4_to_14.1:21.rule: Explicitly declared entities include: associated items, bindings, constants, declarative macros, enum types, enum variants, fields, functions, generic parameters, implementations, labels, modules, statics, struct types, traits, type aliases, union types.

14.2:1.rule: Visibility is a property of fields and items that determines which modules can refer to the name.

14.2:2_14.2:10.rule: Public visibility allows name reference from arbitrary modules; simple public modifier (pub) grants public visibility.

14.2:3_14.2:12.rule: Private visibility allows name reference only by current module and descendants; items without visibility modifier have private visibility.

14.2:5.rule: Crate public modifier pub(crate) grants public visibility within current crate only.

14.2:11.rule: Super public modifier pub(super) grants public visibility within parent module only.

samples.code: pub(super) const fn array_capacity(capacity: usize) -> usize {

14.2:6_14.2:7.rule: Self public modifier pub(self) and simple path public modifier pub(in path) grant restricted visibility.

14.2:13.rule: Associated item of a trait has the same visibility as the trait.
14.2:13.notes: All trait methods inherit trait visibility

14.2:14.rule: Enum variant and its fields have the same visibility as the containing enum type.

14.3:1_to_14.3:3.rule: A path is a sequence of path segments separated by :: that resolves to an entity. Paths are subject to path resolution.

14.3:4.rule: Keywords crate, $crate, self, Self shall be the first path segment.

14.3:6.rule: Keyword super shall be the first path segment or follow another super.

14.3:7.rule: A global path starts with namespace qualifier ::.

14.3:8.rule: A simple path has path segments of identifiers or certain keywords.

crate_paths.description: Paths starting with crate:: for absolute references within current crate

super_paths.description: Paths using super:: to reference parent module

self_paths.description: Paths using self:: for current module references

14.4:1.rule: A scope is a region of program text where an entity can be referred to.

binding_scopes.description: Scopes for bindings introduced by let statements, function parameters, closures

generic_parameter_scopes.description: Scopes for generic parameters in functions, structs, traits, impls
generic_parameter_scopes.notes: See Chapter 12 for generic parameter analysis

label_scopes.description: Scopes for labels in loop expressions
label_scopes.notes: iceoryx2 does not use labeled loops

self_scopes.description: Scopes for Self type within implementations and trait definitions

samples.code: pub fn from_path_and_file(path: &Path, file: &FileName) -> Result<Self, SemanticStringError> {
pub const fn new(a: u8, b: u8, c: u8, d: u8) -> Self {

14.5:1_14.5:2.rule: A namespace is a logical grouping of names. Names are segregated into one of five namespaces.

label_namespace.notes: Not used in iceoryx2 (no labeled loops)

macro_namespace.description: Contains names of attribute macros, built-in attributes, declarative macros, derive macros, function-like macros

type_namespace.description: Contains associated types, bool, enum types, enum variants, modules, numeric types, Self, struct types, textual types, traits, type aliases, type parameters, union types

value_namespace.description: Contains associated constants, associated functions, bindings, constants, constant parameters, enum variant constructors, functions, Self constructors, statics, struct constructors

14.6:1.rule: A prelude is a collection of entities automatically brought in scope of every module.

14.6:2.rule: The core prelude brings in scope entities from core::prelude::rust_2021.

14.6:3.rule: An external prelude brings in scope entities of crates imported using external crate imports.

14.6:4_to_14.6:9.rule: The language prelude brings in scope bool, built-in attributes, f32/f64, integer types, char/str.

custom_prelude.description: iceoryx2 provides its own prelude module for convenient imports

14.7:1.rule: A use import brings entities in scope within the block expression or module.

14.7:9.rule: A simple import brings all entities it refers to into scope.

14.7:10_to_14.7:14.rule: A glob import brings all entities exported by the module or enum into scope.

samples.description: use super::*; common in test modules

14.7:21.rule: Entity imported by simple import subject to renaming is brought into scope under the renaming name.
14.7:21.notes: Renaming imports (as) not used in iceoryx2

14.7:23.rule: A nesting import provides a common simple path prefix for nested use imports.

re_exports.description: pub use statements for re-exporting items

14.8:1.rule: Shadowing is when another name with same characters is introduced in same scope within same namespace.

14.8:2_to_14.8:5.rule: No name shall be shadowed except for prelude names, macro names in textual macro scope, and variable names.

14.8:6_to_14.8:11.rule: Prelude names shadow in order: language prelude, standard library prelude, macro_use prelude, tool prelude, external prelude.

14.9:1.rule: Resolution is the process of finding unique interpretation for field access, method call, call expression, or path.

field_resolution.notes: Field access on structs throughout codebase

path_resolution.description: Resolution of paths by resolving path segments in sequence

visibility_layering.description: Strategic use of visibility modifiers for API design
visibility_layering.pattern: pub for API, pub(crate) for internal, private for implementation

prelude_module.description: Custom prelude module for convenient user imports
prelude_module.benefit: Users can use iceoryx2::prelude::* for common types

module_organization.description: Hierarchical module structure with clear visibility boundaries
module_organization.pattern: Internal details in submodules, public API at module root

re_export_patterns.description: Re-exporting types from dependencies for API convenience

qualified_type_disambiguation.description: Using <Type as Trait> for explicit trait method resolution
qualified_type_disambiguation.rationale: Disambiguates when multiple traits provide same method

cross_chapter_references.chapter_4: Types and Traits - type namespace entities
cross_chapter_references.chapter_6: Expressions - path expressions, method calls, field access
cross_chapter_references.chapter_11: Implementations - inherent and trait implementation resolution
cross_chapter_references.chapter_13: Attributes - attribute resolution in macro namespace
cross_chapter_references.chapter_20: Macros - macro namespace and textual macro scope
